page.title: 11SALTISFORD CANAL,WARWICK.
page.content: Warwick arm of the Grand Union Canal last used in the 30's and had become badly silted and overgrown.Dick Amende when made unemployed,determined to help other unemployed by following up an ambition he had to turn the canal into a children's water activity centre.Labour was provided by government schemes to help the long term unemployed.Money,materials and equipment was donated or loaned by the public and firms.Canal emptied and cleaned out,the mud being used for landscaping.The tow path was restored and residential,longstay,and overnight moorings made.A classroom was erected for an activity centre.Planned to have fishing,canoeing,rowing,nature and canal history studies.Opening July 1985 with over 100 canal boats present.Use of unemployed similar to 1930's when Grand Union locks widened.
